byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jonathan Martin in Myrtle Beach, Thomas Kaplan in Pawleys Island, Ashley Parker in Columbia, and Nick Corasaniti in New York.

abstract: Sen Marco Rubio, Jeb Bush and Ohio Gov John Kasich are all competing in South Carolina to be seen as establishment candidate best suited for taking on hard-liners Donald J Trump and Sen Ted Cruz.
lead_paragraph: Senator Marco Rubio, opening a more aggressive phase of his campaign, suggested Thursday that Donald J. Trump may be too crude to be president and that Jeb Bush, the former Florida governor, may be too inexperienced.

headline.main: Bruised Marco Rubio Gets Personal and Aggressive
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Rivals Jostle to Claim the Position of First of the Insiders

snippet: Senator Marco Rubio, opening a more aggressive phase of his campaign, suggested Thursday that Donald J. Trump may be too crude to be president and that Jeb Bush, the former Florida governor, may be too inexperienced.
